intro: Disperis anthoceros var. humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to specific regions in Africa. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring a strikingly colored lip that plays a crucial role in pollination. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories where humidity is high. Its botanical features include slender, erect stems and lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
